snippet: Several jurors said they could not extend their service to accommodate the translation of wiretapped conversations in Yiddish that prosecutors had failed to turn over promptly to the defense.
abstract: Malcolm A Smith, former majority and minority leader of New York State Senate, is granted mistrial by Federal Judge Kenneth M Karas in his trial for bribery and wire fraud; proceedings fell apart because federal prosecutors failed to turn over promptly to defense more than 70 hours of wiretapped conversations, about a third of them in Yiddish, and translating and digesting them would require jurors to serve longer than some could manage.

byline.contributor: Marc Santora contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Several jurors said they could not extend their service to accommodate the translation of wiretapped conversations in Yiddish that prosecutors had failed to turn over promptly to the defense.

headline.main: Mistrial Is Declared in Malcolm Smith Corruption Trial
headline.print_headline: After Tsoris on Yiddish Tapes, a Mistrial for a State Senator

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
